toc_entry.title: The Empress Of Fort Worth
toc_entry.description: Anne Bass married one of the richest men in america. With his money and her ambition she became an important cultural force in Fort Worth and New York. Life was perfect. Then her husband left her.

toc_entry.title: The Nuevo Frontier
toc_entry.description: On a map the border between Texas and Mexico is a precise demarcation. In the real world the border is a country all its own.

toc_entry.title: The Last Of the Border Lords
toc_entry.description: In his dream to create a dynastic empire along the Rio Grande, Chito Longoria went against the wishes of his family and the values of his native land.

toc_entry.title: Madonna Of the Maquiladora
toc_entry.description: While U.S. businessmen and Mexican bureaucrats see her as the answer to their economic prayers, factory worker Graciela Fernandez just tries to get by—on about 66 cents an hour.

toc_entry.title: The Prophets
toc_entry.description: The border’s self-appointed problem solvers promise new industry, more jobs, and better schools. So why won’t anyone listen to them?.

toc_entry.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
toc_entry.description: Will deprivation, humiliation, and confrontation lead the way to a better, more confident you? a new self-help craze sweeping Texas wants you to think so.

toc_entry.title: The Rose Window
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: The secrets of love seen through a glass, clearly.

toc_entry.title: Undertakers Of the Oil Patch
toc_entry.description: The death of an oil well keeps an oil-field service company alive.

toc_entry.title: Momus To Remember
toc_entry.description: The god of merrymaking spends Mardi Gras in Galveston.

toc_entry.title: Burger Joint Venture
toc_entry.subtitle: Food
toc_entry.description: Want to eat fast and cheap? Fast-food kiosks are the answer. Here’s how these diminutive drivethroughs stack up.

toc_entry.title: The Apple Version
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Walt Disney, Howard Johnson, and Margery Post Merriweather have one thing in common: they’re all trapped inside Max apple’s new novel.

toc_entry.title: You CAN T Get There From Here
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: From Houston’s Miss Molly to San antonio’s Claude Morgan, Texas is full of local music heroes. Does their road to success have to pass through austin?.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: REPORTER
toc_entry.description: The City That Works isn’t working like it used to. Plus amazing Cars of Texas #2, revolutionary folk art, and Topic a —what everybody can’t stop talking about.

toc_entry.title: The National Tour Of Texas
toc_entry.description: The view from the Great Freeway: 1-35 is two things, the speediest drive from Dallas to the Valley and the clearest division of Texas into West and East.

toc_entry.title: The Quidnunc
toc_entry.description: Hunting down ZZ Top impostors; staying dry with party-giver Frances Billups; test-driving fine art in Beaumont.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: A winning ticket for the lottery; the oil bust is a boon for parks; doom and gloom at the Legislature; an early test for Jim Wright.
